Fl.</author> 2, 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:348" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 348</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48910.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">transversa incurrit misera fortuna rei publicae,</quote> <trans><tr>crossed</tr>, <tr>thwarted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:331" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 97, 331</bibl></cit>: cum coepit transversos agere felicitas, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to lead aside</hi> or <hi rend="ital">astray</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">transversum judicem ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:110" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 31, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 1, 1, § 1</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48910.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">transversum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, only with <hi rend="ital">prepp. adv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce autem de transverso L. Caesar, ut veniam ad se, rogat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>contrary to expectation</tr>, <tr>unexpectedly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce tibi iste de transverso, Heus, inquit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 10, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: quod non exspectes, ex transverso fit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec calamitas ex transverso accidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 231" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 231</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48910.7" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">transversē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vorsē</orth>), <hi rend="ital">crosswise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transversely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obliquely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">transverse describantur horae in columellā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 5, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48910.8" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">transversim</orth>, <hi rend="ital">transversely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crosswise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obliquatis manibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transvolito: <entryFree id="n48911" type="hapax" key="transvo^li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-vŏlĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n48911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fly through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clausa domorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 355</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transvolo: <entryFree id="n48912" type="main" key="transvo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-vŏlo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trā-vŏlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n48912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fly over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">across.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48912.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdices non transvolant Boeotiae fines in Atticā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 41, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pontum (grues),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 23, 30, § 60</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48912.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mount</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pass quickly over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">across.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48912.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48912.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: Alpes, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 31, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanum (manus Macedonum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 22, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delphini vela navium transvolant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 7, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transvolat vox auras,</quote> <trans><tr>flies through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 559</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 602</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: importunus (Cupido) transvolat aridas Quercus (i. e. vetulas). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48912.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foraminibus liquidus quia transvolat ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 349</bibl></cit>: eques <cb n="TREB" /> transvolat inde in partem alteram, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:63:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 63, 2</bibl>: Nilus insulas dierum quinque cursu non breviore transvolat, <hi rend="ital">flows by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultur relicto Tityo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1233" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(arma) Travolaverunt ad hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1</bibl></cit>. 1, 33 (for transfugerunt, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 28</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n48912.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa Sallustiana brevitas ... audientem transvolat,</quote> <trans><tr>flies past</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitatio animum subito transvolans,</quote> <trans><tr>flitting through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transvolat in medio posita et fugientia captat,</quote> <trans><tr>passes over</tr>, <tr>neglects</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transvolvo: <entryFree id="n48913" type="main" key="transvolvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-volvo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to roll past</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to unroll</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 11, 29</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 3, 380</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transvoratio: <entryFree id="n48914" type="main" key="transvo^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transvŏrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>transvoro</etym>, <sense id="n48914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gulping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">swallowing down</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:14:113" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 14, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:6:66" default="NO">3, 6, 66</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">concr.,</quote> <trans><tr>the swallow</tr>, <tr>the throat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:11:135" default="NO">2, 11, 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:13:176" default="NO">2, 13, 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transvoro: <entryFree id="n48915" type="main" key="transvo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-vŏro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to gulp down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swallow down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devour</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:3:36" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 3, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">universas opes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to consume</tr>, <tr>squander</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 333, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transvorsus: <entryFree id="n48916" type="main" key="transvorsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transvorsus</orth>, v. transversus.</entryFree>
trapetus: <entryFree id="n48917" type="greek" key="tra^pe_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăpētus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">traphto/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an olivemill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oil-mill</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 519</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 6, 6, § 23</bibl>.—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">trăpētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">traphto/n,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:19:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 19, § 2</bibl>.—And <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trăpētes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tra/phtes,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 4:section=138" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 4, § 138</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:55:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 1, 55, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trapezita: <entryFree id="n48918" type="greek" key="tra^pe_zi_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăpēzīta</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tarpez-, tarpess-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">trapezi/ths,</foreign> <sense id="n48918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a money - changer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banker</hi> (cf. argentarius), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trapezophoron: <entryFree id="n48919" type="greek" key="trape_zo^pho^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trapēzŏphŏron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">trapezofo/ron</foreign> (table - bearer), <sense id="n48919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pedestal</hi> or <hi rend="ital">statue supporting a table</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ornamental table-leg</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:10:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 10, 3</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 3</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
trapezus: <entryFree id="n48920" type="main" key="Tra^pe_zu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trăpēzūs</orth>, <itype>untis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*trapezou=s,</foreign> <sense id="n48920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Pontus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Trebizond</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 4</bibl>, §§ 11 and 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trasumenus: <entryFree id="n48921" type="main" key="Tra^su^me_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trăsŭmēnus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trăsymēnus</orth>, after <foreign lang="greek">*trasume/nh li/mnh,</foreign> in Strabo; and less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trăsĭmēnus</orth>), <itype>Trasimenus lacus, or simply Trasimenus</itype>, <foreign lang="greek">*trasime/nh li/mnh,</foreign> <sense id="n48921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lake in Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Perusia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for Hannibal</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s victory over the Romans</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lago Trasimeno</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Lago di Perugia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:8:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 14, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:13" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:739" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 739</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:8" default="NO">5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:86" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 84, 86, § 200</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:241" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 107, 111, § 241</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:106" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 28, 29, § 106</bibl>.— As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trasimena litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:765" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 765</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trăsĭmēnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Trasimenus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Trasimenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strages,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 247</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
traumaticus: <entryFree id="n48922" type="greek" key="trauma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">traumătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">traumatiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adapted to the healing of wounds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 4, 19</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trau-mătĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a remedy for a wound</hi>, Pelag. Vet. 5; 16.</sense></entryFree>
trausius: <entryFree id="n48923" type="main" key="Trausi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trausĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
traveho: <entryFree id="n48924" type="hapax" key="tra_ve^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trāvĕho</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">trāvectĭo</orth>, v. transv-.</entryFree>
traversus: <entryFree id="n48925" type="main" key="tra_versus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trāversus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. transversus.</entryFree>
travio: <entryFree id="n48926" type="spur" key="tra_vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trāvĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, a false read. for transvolat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 349</bibl>.</entryFree>
travolo: <entryFree id="n48927" type="main" key="tra_vo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trāvŏlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. transvolo.</entryFree>
trebaciter: <entryFree id="n48928" type="main" key="tre^ba_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕbācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. trebax <sense id="n48928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
trebatius: <entryFree id="n48929" type="main" key="Tre^ba_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĕbātĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, C. Testa, <sense id="n48929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lawyer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whom the latter dedicated the</hi> Topica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 5 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 27, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 15</bibl>, A; 9, 17, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7</bibl> (6), 12, 4 al.</sense></entryFree>
trebax: <entryFree id="n48930" type="main" key="tre^bax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕbax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contr. from the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tribako/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n48930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">practised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilled in the ways of the world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crafty</hi> (lat. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">trebacissimus senex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 11</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.—Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕbācĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">cunningly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slyly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
trebellius: <entryFree id="n48931" type="main" key="Tre^belli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĕbellĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. Esp., </sense><sense id="n48931.1" n="I" level="1"> L. Trebellius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 10, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 8, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48931.2" n="II" level="1"> M. Trebellius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 5, 21</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48931.3" n="III" level="1"> Trebellius Maximus, <hi rend="ital">a consul under Nero.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n48931.4" n="IV" level="1"> Trebellius Pollio, <hi rend="ital">a Roman historian under the</hi> <cb n="TREC" /> <hi rend="ital">emperor Constantine;</hi> v. Bähr, Röm. Lit Gesch. § 228.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n48931.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĕbellĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Trebellius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <trans><tr>named after a Trebellius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 69</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48931.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĕbellĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the consul Trebellius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Trebellian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">T. senatusconsultum de fideicommissariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36</bibl></cit>, tit. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">fideicommissarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3:15" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 36, 3, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trebia: <entryFree id="n48932" type="main" key="Tre^bi^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĕbĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*trebi/as, o(</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">potamo/s</foreign>), <sense id="n48932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Upper Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for Hannibal</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s victory over the Romans</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Trebbia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:52 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 52 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:495" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 495</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:645" default="NO">4, 645</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:707" default="NO">6, 707</bibl>; 9, 189.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48933" type="main" key="Tre^bi^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĕbĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a village in Umbria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Trevi</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 122</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n48933.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĕ-bĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Trebia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Trebian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 14, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 126</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĕbĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Trebia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48933.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĕbĭātes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Trebia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trebius: <entryFree id="n48934" type="main" key="Trebi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trebĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n48934.1" n="I" level="1"> Statius Trebius, <hi rend="ital">who surrendered his native town Compsa to Hannibal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 1, 1</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48934.2" n="II" level="1"> Trebius Niger, <hi rend="ital">a historian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">companion of Lucullus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proconsul of</hi> Hispania Bætica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 25, 41, § 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:89" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 30, 48, § 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 18, 20, § 40</bibl>; 32, 2, 6, § 15.</sense></entryFree>
trebonius: <entryFree id="n48935" type="main" key="Tre^bo_nius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĕbōnius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n48935.1" n="I" level="1"> C. Trebonius, <hi rend="ital">a legate of Cœsar in Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 14, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:69:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 69, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48935.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The father of the preceding</hi>, C. Trebonius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 10, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48935.3" n="III" level="1"> Another of the name is mentioned, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trebula: <entryFree id="n48936" type="main" key="Tre_bu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trēbŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of three Italian towns.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48936.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Suessula and Saticula</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Maddaloni</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 39, 6</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trēbŭlānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Trebula</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Trebulan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 69</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trēbŭlānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an estate near Trebula</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 2, 2</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trēbŭlāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, with the addition Balinienses, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Trebula</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Trebulans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 64</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n48936.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in the Sabine territory</hi>, Trebula Mutusca, now <hi rend="ital">Monte Leone</hi>, Jul. Obs. 102; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Trebula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:71:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 71, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and Mutusca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 711</bibl></cit>. The inhabitants are called Trēbŭlāni Mutuscaei, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 107</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Hence, Trebulanus ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48936.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another town in the Sabine territory</hi>, the inhabitants of which are called Trebulani Suffenates, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trebulanus: <entryFree id="n48937" type="main" key="Tre_bu^la_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trēbŭlānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Trebula.</entryFree>
trecenarius: <entryFree id="n48938" type="main" key="tre^ce_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕcēnārĭus</orth> ( TERCENARIVS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 387, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">417, 5</bibl>), a, um, <sense id="n48938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. num.</hi> [treceni]. </sense><sense id="n48938.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to three hundred</hi>: vites, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that yield three hundred</hi> amphorae <hi rend="ital">of wine to the juger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 7</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n48938.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A soldier whose pay is three hundred</hi> sestertia (cf. ducenarius), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 365, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">387, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">417, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
treceni: <entryFree id="n48939" type="main" key="tre^ce_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕcēni</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">tercēni</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Rest. Schol. 11</bibl>), ae, a (<sense id="n48939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> trecenorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trecenūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:7:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">num. distr. adj.</hi> [tres-centum]. </sense><sense id="n48939.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">three hundred each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three hundred</hi> distributively: <cit><quote lang="la">treceni equites in singulis legionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:38:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 38, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 8, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiae in singulas colonias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummi in capita Romana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:52:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 52, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of an indefinitely large number: <cit><quote lang="la">non si trecenis, quotquot eunt dies, Amice, places illacrimabilem Plutona tauris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 5</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48939.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">three hundred</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere ducenis annis et quosdam trecenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 10, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trecenteni: <entryFree id="n48940" type="main" key="tre^cente_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕcentēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n48940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. distrib. adj.</hi> [trecenti], <hi rend="ital">three hundred each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trecentesimus: <entryFree id="n48941" type="main" key="tre^cente_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕcentēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the three-hundredth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:13" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trecenti: <entryFree id="n48942" type="main" key="tre^centi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕcenti</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭcenti</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 5</bibl>), ae, a (<sense id="n48942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> trecentūm. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:44:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 44, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 37</bibl>), <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>tres-centum</etym>, <hi rend="ital">three hundred</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummi Philippii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Leonidas se in Thermopylis trecentosque eos, quos eduxerat Spartā, opposuit hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:30:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 30, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad trecentos viros trucidavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 173</bibl></cit>: usque ad milia basiem trecenta,<pb n="1895" /> <cb n="TREM" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 48, 3</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">trecenta milia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 164</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trecenta debet Titius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:37:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a sene postquam patruo venere trecenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:70:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 70, 7</bibl></cit>.—To denote an indefinitely large number: <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amatorem trecentae Pirithoum cohibent catenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trecenties: <entryFree id="n48943" type="main" key="tre^centi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕcentĭes</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭcentĭes</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:22:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 22, 1</bibl>), <pos>adv. num.</pos> <etym>trecenti</etym>, <sense id="n48943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">three hundred times</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:29:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 29, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:22:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 22, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trechedipnum: <entryFree id="n48944" type="greek" key="tre^che^di_pnum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕchĕdīpnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. vestimentum), = <foreign lang="greek">trexe/deipnon</foreign> (running to a banquet), <sense id="n48944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a light garment worn at table by parasites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:67" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 67</bibl> (trechedipna vestimenta parasitica currentium ad cenam, Schol.).</sense></entryFree>
tredecies: <entryFree id="n48945" type="spur" key="tre^de^ci^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕdĕcĭes</orth>, a false read. for terdeciens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:80:section=184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 80, § 184</bibl>.</entryFree>
tredecim: <entryFree id="n48946" type="main" key="tre^de^cim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕdĕcim</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">tresd-</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 33" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 33</bibl>), <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>tres-decem</etym>, <sense id="n48946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thirteen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tredecim captis navibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 45, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum tredecim senatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus emptus talentis tredecim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:2:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit> (for which we have decem et tres, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem tres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 30, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem tria milia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; v. decem).</sense></entryFree>
treis: <entryFree id="n48947" type="main" key="treis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">treis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trīs</orth>, v. tres <sense id="n48947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tremebundus: <entryFree id="n48948" type="main" key="tre^me^bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕmĕbundus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trĕmĭb-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tremo</etym>, <sense id="n48948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trembling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quivering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaking</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">(Iphigenia) tremibunda ad aras Deducta est, Lucr 1, 95: tremebunda manu tangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:52:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 52, 134</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Caius a primā tremebundus luce,</quote> <trans><tr>trembling with fear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:93:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 93, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 133</bibl></cit>: leo, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 440</bibl>: tremebundā voce, Auct. Her 3, 14, 25.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: (cucumis) effetae tremebundior ubere porcae, i.e. <hi rend="ital">more flabby</hi>, <hi rend="ital">softer</hi>, Col. poët. 10, 396. — </sense><sense id="n48948.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornus (i.e. hasta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:119" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:628" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 628</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. Const. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tremefacio: <entryFree id="n48949" type="main" key="tre^me^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕmĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tremo-facio</etym>, <sense id="n48949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cause to shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quake</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">tremble</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">(Juppiter) Annuit, et totum nutu tremefecit Olympum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum caelum supercilio et nutu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lernam arcu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:804" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 804</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thulem belli murmure,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 204</bibl></cit>: se tremefecit tellus, <hi rend="ital">quaked</hi>, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 11, 18.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia tremefacta Noto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 34</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scuticae habenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quies pueri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 247</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tremefactio: <entryFree id="n48950" type="main" key="tre^me^facti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕmĕfactĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trembling</hi> (late Lat.); <cit><quote lang="la">only transf.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 103, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tremendus: <entryFree id="n48951" type="main" key="tre^mendus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕmendus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. tremo <sense id="n48951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
trementer: <entryFree id="n48952" type="main" key="tre^menter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕmenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n48952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with trembling</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Serm. 24</bibl>; Dracont. Hexaëm. 671.</sense></entryFree>
tremesco: <entryFree id="n48953" type="main" key="tre^mesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕmesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trĕmisco</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n48953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a. inch.</hi> [tremo], <hi rend="ital">to begin to shake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tremble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quake</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">tremble for fear; to quake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tremble at</hi> a thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">plaustri concussa tremescunt Tecta viam propter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:548" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 548</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitruque tremescunt Ardua terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 694</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubeo tremescere montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latitans omnemque tremescens Ad strepitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:214" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 214</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitumque pedum vocemque tremesco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrygia arma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 403</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum instare tremescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:916" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 916</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercum nutantem nemus et mons ipse tremescit, Quā tellure cadat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:535" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 535</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tremipes: <entryFree id="n48954" type="hapax" key="tre^mi^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕmĭpēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tremo-pes</etym>, <sense id="n48954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trembling-footed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with trembling feet</hi>: anates tremipedes, Varr ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 460, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tremis: <entryFree id="n48955" type="main" key="tre_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trēmis</orth>, <itype>issis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>formed after the analogy of semis, from tres and as</etym>; under the later emperors, <sense id="n48955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the third part of an</hi> aureus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 40, 3</bibl>; cf. semis, II. A. 2.</sense></entryFree>
tremo: <entryFree id="n48956" type="main" key="tre^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕmo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n48956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tre/mw,</foreign> to tremble; <foreign lang="greek">a)tre/mas,</foreign> quiet]. </sense><sense id="n48956.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tremble</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.; cf. trepido): sapiens si algebis, tremes, Novat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or.2, 70, 285</bibl> (Com.Rel. v. 116 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">pro monstro extemplo'st, quando qui sudat tremit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viden', ut tremit atque extimuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totus Tremo horreoque, Ter Eun. 1, 2, 4: si qui tremerent et exalbescerent objecta terribili re extrinsecus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 15, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timidus ac tremens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:30:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 30, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremo animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:1:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 833" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 833</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto pectore tremens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:22:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 22, 49</bibl></cit>: corde et genibus tremit, Hor. C. <cb n="TREM" /> 1, 23, 8.—In a Greek construction: <cit><quote lang="la">tremis ossa pavore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingemit et tremit artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:489" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 489</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 84</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n48956.2" n="B" level="2"> Of things: mare caelum terram ruere ac tremere diceres, Afran. ap. Prob. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 31</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 9 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">membra miserae tremunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus, Verg, A. 3, 627: manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 509</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec trementi questus ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:11" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ore tremente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:54" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 54</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Africa terribili tremit horrida terra tumultu, Enn. ap. Fest p. 153 Müll. (Ann. v. 311 Vahl.): verbere ripae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:8" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta per armos Acta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 645</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frusta (carnis),</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>to quiver</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seges altis flava spicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip 50" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Med. 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48956.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to quake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tremble at</hi> a thing (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and perhaps not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">virgas ac secures dictatoris tremere atque horrere, Liv, 22, 27, 3: Junonem Offensam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque iratos Regum apices neque militum arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussa virum nutusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:53" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te Stygii tremuere lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non praesidum gladios tremunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varios casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 262" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 317" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 317</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕmendus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P a.</hi> (acc. to II.), that is to be trembled at; hence, <hi rend="ital">fearful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dreadful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frightful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formidable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tremendous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">manes adiit regemque tremendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chimaera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates visu audituque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:164" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 577</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuspis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monita Carmentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:209" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigris animal velocitatis tremendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 18, 25, § 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tremor: <entryFree id="n48957" type="main" key="tre^mor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕmor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tremo</etym>, <sense id="n48957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quivering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trembling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tremor.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48957.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48957.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.; cf. trepidatio); <cit><quote lang="la">terrorem pallor et tremor consequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 19</bibl></cit>; cf <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 15, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo tremore et pallore dixit!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia corusca prae tremore fabulor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidusque per ima cucurrit Ossa tremor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subitus tremor occupat artus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 446</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Ov M. 3, 40: donec manibus tremor incidat unctis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota tremor pertemptet equorum Corpora, Verg G 3, 250: errat per artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc Oet. 706" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc Oet. 706</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 7, 24, § 40</bibl>.—Personified: <cit><quote lang="la">Frigus iners illic habitant Pallorque Tremorque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:790" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 790</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48957.3" n="b" level="4"> Of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">dum tremor (ignium) est clarus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 587</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48957.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an earthquake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremor terras graviter pertentat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 287</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:577" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 577</bibl>; Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 27</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 547</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:699" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 699</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 271</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 798</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 414</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:21:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 10, 15, § 73</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48957.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>, like terror, of that which causes trembling, fear, etc., <hi rend="ital">a dread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terror</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">(Cacus) silvarum tremor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:65:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 65, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:24:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 24, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 123</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tremule: <entryFree id="n48958" type="main" key="tre^mu^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕmŭlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tremulus <sense id="n48958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tremulus: <entryFree id="n48959" type="main" key="tre^mu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕmŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tremo</etym>. <sense id="n48959.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">shaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quivering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trembling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tremulous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">incurvus, tremulus, labiis demissis, gemens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus annisque metuque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 414</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 73: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passus (senilis hiemis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">guttur, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 8, 14: ut mare fit tremulum, tenui cum stringitur aura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:326" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupressus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 131</bibl></cit>: flamma, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 43, 110; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 105</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jubar ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 696</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 2, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>restless</tr>, <tr>spirited</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyn. 256</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 84</bibl> and 250).— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: sacopenium sanat vertigines, tremulos, opisthotonicos, i.e. <hi rend="ital">shaking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trembling in the joints</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 18, 75, § 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:85" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 9, 34, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:92" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 4, 47, § 92</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">(puella) tam tremulum crissat,</quote> <trans><tr>tremblingly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:203:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 203, 1</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48959.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that causes one to shake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shiver</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 68</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕmŭlē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">tremblingly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 168, 28</bibl>. <cb n="TREP" /></sense></entryFree>
trepidanter: <entryFree id="n48960" type="main" key="tre^pi^danter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕpĭdanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. trepido <sense id="n48960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin</hi></sense></entryFree>
trepidatio: <entryFree id="n48961" type="main" key="tre^pi^da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕpĭdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <sense id="n48961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [trepido], <hi rend="ital">a state of confused hurry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">alarm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consternation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trepidation</hi> (not freq. till the Aug. per.): numquae trepidatio? numqui tumultus? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 7, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae senatūs trepidatio, quae populi confusio, quis urbis metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 124</bibl></cit>: cujus rei subita trepidatio magnum terrorem attulit nostris, Auct. B. Alex. 75, 2; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec opinata res plus trepidationis fecit, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut jam ex trepidatione concurrentium turba constitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 50, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilis inter primam trepidationem abjectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidationem inicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:53:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 53, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidatio fugaque hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 24, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia non naturae sed trepidationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:121" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidatione mendacium prodere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum pectori per trepidationem admovens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 43</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in quā trepidatione multae captae naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:12:27" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum magnā trepidatione vigilavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a trembling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:10:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trepide: <entryFree id="n48962" type="main" key="tre^pi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕpĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. trepidus <sense id="n48962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
trepidiarius: <entryFree id="n48963" type="main" key="tre^pi^di^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕpĭdĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>trepidus</etym>, <sense id="n48963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">restless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moving briskly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ipsos equos, quos vulgo trepidiarios, militari verbo tottonarios vocant, ita edomant, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 56, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trepido: <entryFree id="n48964" type="main" key="tre^pi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕpĭdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n48964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to hurry with alarm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bustle about anxiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be in a state of confusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitation</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">trepidation</hi> (class., but not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut ille trepidabat! ut festinabat miser!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with festinare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est quod trepidas, Ter Eun. 5, 5, 8: tum demum Titurius trepidare, concursare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidare omnibus locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currere per totum pavidi conclave magisque Exanimes trepidare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum in sua quisque ministeria discursu trepidat ad prima signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 16, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidante totā civitate ad excipiendum Poenum visendumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa vallum (hostes), Auct. B. Afr. 82, 1: circum artos cavos (mures),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigiles tumultuari, trepidare, moliri portam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 28, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis trepidandum in acie instruendā erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:38:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 38, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum trepidant alae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lymphati trepidare coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at Romanus homo ... Corde suo trepidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:4:7" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe trepido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidare laetitiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7</bibl></cit>, n. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:20" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa manu medicā Phoebique potentibus herbis Nequiquam trepidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam veluti pueri trepidant atque omnia caecis In tenebris metuunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 35</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ancipiti trepidant terrore per urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:596" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 596</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recenti mens trepidat metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metu falso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr 1, 5, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formidine belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:10:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dubiis periclis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1076" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1076</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridetque (deus), si mortalis ultra Fas trepidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 32</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidari sentio et cursari rursum prorsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totis trepidatur castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi jam trepidatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 598</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastis trepidatur in arvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:26" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si gradibus trepidatur ab imis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:200" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 200</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48964.1" n="(b)" level="5"> Like tremo with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to tremble at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be afraid of</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">et motae ad lunam trepidabis harundinis umbram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:21" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occursum amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:152" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupos (damae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1058" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1058</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48964.2" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ne trepidate meas, Teucri, defendere naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occurrere morti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:639" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 639</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48964.3" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidat, ne Suppositus venias et falso nomine poscas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:97" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:64" default="NO">14, 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48964.4" n="b" level="4"> Of things, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:965" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 965</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (aqua) per pronum trepidat cum murmure rivum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">obliquo laborat Lympha fugax trepidare rivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammae trepidant,</quote> <trans><tr>flare</tr>, <tr>waver</tr>, <tr>flicker</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 11, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidantia exta,</quote> <trans><tr>throbbing</tr>, <tr>quivering</tr>, <tr>palpitating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic aquilam pennā fugiunt trepidante columbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:506" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub dentibus artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:196" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 196</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48964.5" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">octavum trepidavit aetas Claudere lustrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 24</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕpĭdanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">trem blingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timorously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with trepidation</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">trepidanter effatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 49</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidantius timidiusque agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trepidulus: <entryFree id="n48965" type="hapax" key="tre^pi^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕpĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n48965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.] <pb n="1896" /> <cb n="TREV" /> <hi rend="ital">trembling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timorous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulli circumstrepere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trepidus: <entryFree id="n48966" type="main" key="tre^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tre/pw,</foreign> to turn, put to flight; cf. Lat. torqueo (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=367" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 367</bibl> Müll.); prop. scared; hence</etym>, <sense id="n48966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">restless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solicitous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alarmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a state of trepidation</hi>, etc. (not. freq. in prose till the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. not at all in Cic. and Cæs.): tum trepidae inter se coëunt pennisque coruscant (apes),</quote> <trans><tr>in a hurry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 73</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Dido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 642</bibl></cit> Serv.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic galeam tectis trepidus rapit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 638</bibl></cit>;
